Description: Combination medication used to relieve cough and chest congestion. Guaifenesin helps loosen mucus, while hydrocodone suppresses cough reflex.
Side Effects: Side effects may include dizziness, drowsiness, and constipation. Risk of misuse and dependence on hydrocodone.
Dosage: Adults: 1-2 teaspoons every 4-6 hours; Children: Dosage varies by age.

Description: Cough suppressant containing hydrocodone and a non-narcotic cough reliever. Used to relieve severe coughs and upper respiratory tract infections.
Side Effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, nausea, and constipation. Risk of dependency and misuse.
Dosage: Adults: 1-2 teaspoons every 4-6 hours; Children: Consult physician.

Description: Over-the-counter medication for cough and chest congestion. Contains dextromethorphan to suppress cough and guaifenesin to loosen mucus.
Side Effects: Possible side effects include dizziness, drowsiness, and gastrointestinal upset. Rarely, allergic reactions may occur.
Dosage: Adults: 10-20 mL every 4 hours; Children: 5-10 mL every 4 hours.

Description: Extended-release capsule containing a combination of hydrocodone and chlorpheniramine. Used for cough relief and alleviating allergy symptoms.
Side Effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and dry mouth. Possible risk of abuse and dependency.
Dosage: Adults: 1-2 capsules every 12 hours; Children: Not recommended.

Description: Combination medication containing hydrocodone and phenylephrine, used for treating cough and nasal congestion.
Side Effects: May cause drowsiness, dizziness, and dry mouth. Risk of misuse, dependence, and interactions with other medications.
Dosage: Adults: 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours; Children: Consult physician.
